intro: Piscipula, commonly known as the sea holly, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its striking blue or purple flower heads, which are surrounded by bracts that resemble leaves. Native to the coastal regions of the Mediterranean, it thrives in saline and sandy soils. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and blooms from late summer to autumn. Its unique appearance and adaptability to coastal environments make it a notable species in maritime flora.
